result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin Brian Kaesermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: For Compensation
Final/Only Invoice for Co. Apt.
Payment plan of $50/month commencing 12.1.22

1:15 PM Defendant Austin Brian Kaesermann in court.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by phone for Austin Brian Kaesermann.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form efiled.  Court does plea colloquy w/defendant. Defendant advised of rights. Defendant enters plea of NC to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1 and count 2 is DRI. Court imposes a $150 fine plus costs. Payment plan of $50/month commencing 12/01/2022.

8:30 AM NOT ON THE RECORD Defendant Austin Brian Kaesermann appeared by phone.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by phone for Austin Brian Kaesermann.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Defense has received an offer and discovery. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling conference on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

*NOT ON RECORD* Defendant Austin Brian Kaesermann appeared by phone.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by phone for Austin Brian Kaesermann.  Attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery received, Offer has not been extended - Defense is seeking a global offer, Attorney Gabler will work on it
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

AMENDED - with cases 22CM316 & 22CM470
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Larry Lloyd is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 7/1/22.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
